page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Milnrow}and{Newhey}are industrial villages on the edge of Rochdale. They lie on the western edge of the Pennines. In the last fifteen years Milnrow has expanded with the development of several housing estates and now has a population of about 12,000. The area originally known as Butterworth became known as Milnrow when a man called Milne built a row of houses for his mill workers. In the past coal mining, cotton and woollen mills were important in the area but these have now closed and engineering firms are the main employers. Many farmhouses in the area date back to the 17th century for example Moorbank Farm which was built in 1632. The farms are now mainly pastoral with dairy farming being the dominant form.
